content.description:
Another techy, scrunchy, unconfirmed testpiece! Sit start with a good low left hand hold at the start of the elongated slab. Right hand hold is a few feet to the right on a bad sloping blob. Find a high left foot and pull onto the wall. Balance up to a sloping gaston before pressing and gaining a high right foot then punch for a jug.

 A more positive edge to the right of the sloping right hand blob may end up being the more natural starting hold in the future.
content.protection: 1 pad, maybe two. A block under the problem makes the start a bit awkward.
content.location: This problem is found on the Magnitude Boulder at the bottom of the Landslide 2020 area. This problem itself is found just to the right of the very long slab. It is found between "Two Hands in the Mayonnaise" and "Lovely Lady Bumps".

content.description:
Sit start the slab with a small two finger left hand edge and a three finger right hand edge out right. Find the appropriate foot smears and make a hard pull on to the wall. Balance your way up to some slopey holds and continue straight up with a delicate move to the lip.

 Venturing further left into "One Foot in the Gravy" makes the top section easier. I ended up gettting a high left foot on the rightmost sloping rail of the mentioned problem.

 The stand start is really good and probably around V3. I started with a right hand sidepull thumb-press and a lefthand palm press. Climb straight up using a few small edges and some smear and trust some sloping feet.
content.protection: 2-3 pads. The top is a bit delicate
content.location: A few feet to the right of the obvious scoop with the flat sloping rails at shoulder height. The starting edges are small.

content.description: Sit start the short overhanging section with a right hand undercling sidepull, and a left to the left on an oppossing sidepull undercling. Pick a foot and make a hard move up to a large horn-like feature/ undercling. From here, figure out how to press up and cross up to a hold on the slab before exiting left and topping to nice slab.
content.location: This problem is found directly behind the bolted problem, "To Bolt or Not to Boulder".

content.description: Traverse left to right starting on the jug on the arete, Top out at the highest point on the boulder near the high dirty jug. Get a high foot and move right to a crimp from the start. Work your way into the corner where "One Foot in the Gravy" starts and get a good rest on the start jug and foot. Then paste your smears, and move right using some tiny crimps and a whole lot of balance. Avoiding using the top of the boulder at the beginning makes the grade more consistent.
content.location: This climb is on the same face of the boulder as One Foot In the Gravy. It starts on the left edge and traverses the face right until you get to the dirty jug just before the face starts to turn the corner.

content.description: Stand start with a good left hand edge and a large foot. Pull onto the wall and reach right to a large sidepull jug, from here venture up to the top.
content.location: This problem is found to the right of the scarred tree on the Magnitude Boulder. The left hand start hold of this problem is used as the right hand on "Des Arbres".

content.description:
An interesting slab dihedral problem. May end up a bit softer once all the sand and mud is cleaned off. 

 Start matched on a larger flat hold, move left out to a crimp, cross right into another crimp. Get your feet up and mantle-smear off the dihedral to reach for the lip.
content.protection: Couple of pads -- you'll need to stack them to fill the "grave"
content.location: Locate the further downhill of the two large boulders that fell. You'll find this problem on the north side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a crescent-shaped right hand sidepull and a good sloping sidepull found low on the left arete. Pull on to the face and cross up to a good incut edge, then cross over to a larger rail. Once here figure out how to get up to the underclings above before a cruxy sequence smacking a sloper and jumping to the lip.An alternate sit start was also done. Start sitting on a large undercling to the left of the arete. This is the same start hold used for "Bumpy Road". Pull on and figure out how to gain the holds out right on the face.
content.location: This problem is on the lowest of the large blocks that tumbled down the hill. The face this problem climbs faces the cliffs in which they fell.

content.description: Start crossed on a quartz edge and an incut just to the right of it. Figure out some feet and how to move up to a blocky pinch hold and a sloping undercling. After some hard foot moves, stand up and smack some slopers and jump to the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: 3 or 4 pads. The landing is halfway decent, but the tension on the climb is vast, so ejection is a possibility.
content.location: This problem is on the sheer, almost blank face of the large boulder found at the bottom of the cluster. This boulder is also home to "Goat Path" and "Bumpy Road" along with "Slab Ambassador".

content.description: A technical and delicate test piece!Sit start a crescent moon shaped sidepull for the right hand, and left hand low on the left arete. Pull up to a good left hand edge then head right utilizing some small holds and some trickery. With difficulty, reach for a good edge at the bottom of the dihedral-like feature and continue straight up.
content.protection: 2 pads. The landing is fairly flat and safe.
content.location: This problem climbs the near vertical face on the large boulder at the bottom of the Landslide Boulders. It shares the same Sit Start as "Meticulous Magnitude Sit".The problem is to the left of the well scarred tree.

content.description: Stand start at the base of the sloping dihedral like feature. The left hand hold is a slopey gaston on the feature and the right hand is a bitey crimp just to the right.  Find a way to pull onto the wall and punch up lefty to a better gaston, then move up right hand to a thin horizontal seam and then go for the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads. Landing is a bit uneven and there is a tree to the right.
content.location: This problem is on the Magnitude Boulder. It is the large boulder at the bottom section of the Landslide 2020 area. This problem shares the same clean aesthetic face as "Meticulous Magnitude" but is found to the right, just left of the well-scarred tree. "Magnificent Munificence" links "Meticulous Magnitude Sit" into this problem.

content.description:
Awesome sloping blobs, hard move to another blob and bump to a jug. Classic.

  Sit start with a sloping left hand pinch and a blob sloper for the right, find feet, pull on with difficulty, smack a blob then bump to a glorious jug. From here get the feet up and exit into easier terrain to the top of the block.

 The start is a bit scrunchy and awkward due to a rock under the landing, but the series of holds are fun and friendly.
content.location: Found on the Magnitude Boulder, this problem is found to the left of the obvious blunt arete on the short section just before the elongated slab begins.

content.description: Stand start with a slopey left hand hold and a slightly lower right hand hold that has some bite for a few fingers. Pull onto the wall and move up to a glassy right hand sidepull then move out left to a large gaston hold. Move some feet and lock off to a good hold then reach for the lip and top out.
content.protection: a pad. There is a chakstone that I didn't use, but couldn't remove. It is right next to the large left hand gaston.
content.location: This climb is found on the new boulder down the hill from the Bolted Boulder. This problem is around to the right of "Bump Road", past the blank face, in the corridor.

content.description: Stand start behind the well-scarred tree with a good right hand hold and not much for the left. Pull on and hit a good crimp lefty, then figure out how to make it to the lip dab-free.
content.protection: 1 pad. One can stem against the tree incase of fear of failure to evade a fall.
content.location: Squeezed between the well-scarred forked tree facing the cliffs. Just to the right of "Magnanimity".

content.description: Sit or squat start on a small left hand crimp and an incut right hand, on a good ledge foot. Find your way through some good crimps to the topout straight up.
content.location: On the road side of the Magnitude Boulder, on the right side.

content.description: Sit start on the left side of the lip on big quartz holds, traverse the lip, top out on the right arete.
content.location: On the road side of the Magnitude boulder, start on the left and traverse right.

content.description: Sit start on a big undercling make a move to the arete and grab good holds out left. Keep moving over until you can grab the quartz jug with your right hand. Tricky to figure out at first but fairly easy.
content.location: On the boulder with One foot in the gravy. Behind the bolted boulder.

content.description: This is a large boulder that is home to many great slab and face climbs and a few burly climbs as well. This boulder provides the climber with everything from V-Easy up to a super technical and crimpy V8.
